𒌋𒌋 MAN 𓀀 & women 𓁐 = 𒌍 𒌋𒌋 sin-niš gynes female
𒌋𒌋 king & 𒌍 𒌋𒌋 queen ≈ gyne

𒌋𒌋 Amun king in 𒉆𒂗 nam-en ˢʸnamen syn-amun shar-amen the office of en-priest; kingship

The bureaucratic and ceremonial rules for passing kingship between generations, successor and locations were central to the formation of civilization.

There is an excessive unexpected duality of complement cereal names and regnal names:

Early names for this title are:

Šar Shar shartan sultan, reflected in zar, xerces and caesar 𒌋𒌋
